pronunciation: VAG'ABOND, [Latin vagabundus, from vagor, to wander; from the root of wag.]

definitions.text:
Vagabond
1. Wandering; moving place place without any settled habitation; as vagabond exile.
2. Wandering; floating about without any certain direction; driven fro.Like vagabond flag upon stream.VAG'ABOND,
vagrant; one who wanders town town place place, having no certain dwelling, not abiding it. By laws England United States, vagabonds are liable be taken up punished.
